title: Process Development Engineer, Cellulose-based products
job_description:
Are you interested in developing new technologies and cellulose fibre-based products and looking for a new job opportunity in the field? Would you like to do impactful research in the cutting edge of natural sciences with superb colleagues who are top expert in their field? Do you want to build a science career and work in a versatile role at the interface of academy and industry? VTT might be just the place for you.

 
VTT is one of the leading applied research organisations in Europe. What unites us are curiosity, a passion for learning and a purpose: to solve the biggest challenges of our time and turn them into sustainable growth and well-being. Our cross-disciplinary community of over 2000 brilliant minds is focused on creating impact through science-based innovation.â¯ Get to know us further by exploring VTTâs research infra atâ¯VTT World. 
 

We are now looking for a Process Development Engineer to join our Cellulose-based product solutions -team.
 

Your key goal is to contribute to the research projects related to the development of new industrial process technologies needed for new fiber based products. In this position, you will have a major role in upscaling research for our customers. Your research activities include pilot and laboratory scale research and pre-tests.

Our team, Cellulose-based product solutions, works on innovating and developing novel applications for cellulose-based materials. Upscaling concepts, using design approach, and supporting commercialisation efforts form a substantial part of our work. Based on scientific research, we develop new cellulose-based applications that fulfil the customerâs needs, as well as help them in transition to circular economy with bio-based materials.

As a Process Development Engineer you will: 

  • draw detailed research plans together with our industry customers and other VTT experts, and carry out research work accordingly,
  • lead pilot trials on-site at VTTâs pilot lines in JyvÃ¤skylÃ¤
  • use your fluent skills in English to write research reports and publications that help the team communicate its results clearly
  • help to maintain and upgrade research infrastructure needed for carrying out world class research work
  • participate in brainstorming future solutions for continuous processes needed to produce new and improved existing fiber based products
     

Who we are looking for:

  • We expect you to have at least MSc (Tech.) level degree
  • You have product and process development experience in the field of paper, board, tissue, and/or nanocellulose technology
  • It is a clear additional benefit if you have relevant work experience from industrial processes working e.g., as a process development engineer
  • You are familiar with barrier materials and technologies in the packaging sector
  • We favour candidates who have practical experience in working and developing pilot or industrial scale machinery, continuous processes, automation, and on-line measurement devices, and fiber based product properties.
     

As a person, we hope that you are:

  • You are able and willing to learn new things continuously.
  • You enjoy challenges and have a strong passion for work.
  • We also expect the willingness to collaborate with experts and partners across different fields.
     

With VTT, youâll enjoy:

  • Natural sciences with an impact and visionary work in technology. Our research agenda is dedicated to solving systemic and technological challenges, so your work will go towards creating real, positive impact. VTT works on the cutting-edge of natural sciences, and weâve invested into building state-of-the-art research facilities for natural sciences, such as the Bioruukki pilot infrastructure for bio- and circular economy. Read more about our strategy â the path of exponential hope.
  • Superb colleagues and community. With VTT, youâll join a community of over 2000 multidisciplinary experts who foster a culture of trust, openness and sharing knowledge. We work truly across disciplines, and house all the cutting-edge sciences from quantum computing to synthetic biology under one roof. Collaborating with superb colleagues is a source of learning, inspiration, and fun.  
  • Excellent career in research. At VTT, excellence in research is a strategic priority. We offer long-term positions and stable career paths in top-level research. People tend to stay with us over 10 years since there are always new roles and responsibilities to grow into. A combination of cutting-edge academic research and applied customer projects keeps your career path interesting.
  • Support for your well-being. Our people are our main asset, so we take good care of them. We aim to nurture great team spirit and leadership and offer versatile well-being services to enable a good workâlife balance. On top of 6 weeks of paid holidays we offer exercise and culture benefits, hobby clubs, and voluntary well-being services such as meditation programmes and trainings on cognitive ergonomics.
